# lottery

```{r parameters, echo=F}
sample_size <- 10000
```


I will randomly sample **`r sample_size`** numbers and calculate their mean.
Remember to set the seed!
```{r data_sampling, results='hide', cashe=T}
set.seed(23)
x <- rnorm(sample_size)
m <- mean(x)
m
```
```{r plot}
plot(x)
```

```{r data2, echo=F, message=F, warning=F, error=F}
library("dplyr")
library("ggplot2")
p <- ggplot(data.frame(x=x), aes(x=x)) + 
  geom_histogram(bins=50, fill="#009988") +
  geom_vline(xintercept=m) +
  scale_fill_brewer("set1") +
  theme_bw()
p
```

```{r kable}
df <- data.frame(a = rnorm(26), b = LETTERS)
knitr::kable(summary(df))
```
